poem.title: God Loves A Drunk
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Her man came off the wagon (better jump before you're pushed) Down a flight of stairs. A fractured nut. The surgeon warned of a character change and she said no such luck. At the time, we thought that brave and funny. In the boss's private ward we were whispering what Afflicts him so? What ails him? The monitor spiked: "Did you say ale?" Next day we found out She'd sold the business.
